newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia forex trade twice normal amount, peso off.
newsitem.headline: Colombia forex trade twice normal amount, peso off.

text.p: A deluge of dollars boosted trade on Colombia's foreign exchange markets to twice the normal amount, but a vigilant Central Bank nonetheless succeeded in keeping the peso on a downward tilt.
Interbank foreign exchange dealers in Colombia reported a total day's trade of $392 million Friday -- about twice the daily average.
Markets were flooded with greenbacks as Chilean power company Endesa paid the Colombian government $302 million for a 99 percent stake in the Betania hydroelectric generator.
On top of that, dollar revenues from coffee and oil exports poured in.
Colombia's central bank, however, continued its crawling peg devalaution of the peso and backed the dollar heavily. Interbank dealers saw the bank buying at least $250 million.
The peso closed down 0.36 at 1,003.89 to the dollar. The peso sunk to an intraday low of 1,003.94 and closed at the day's high.
